name: Michael Howell From Capital Wars
title: Prospects For A Puzzling 2025
text:
Synopsis
China's economic challenges are becoming increasingly apparent, with declining marginal returns on capital and potential debt deflation, signaling significant economic headwinds that could reshape global economic dynamics in 2025.

Key Insights
- China's marginal returns on capital have dramatically dropped from around 14% to barely 5% by 2029 (projected)
- The US has maintained competitive marginal returns on capital, now at least as good as China's
- China is experiencing potential debt deflation, with bond yields collapsing
- China continues to face challenges in matching US productivity and challenging US financial and political hegemony
- The global economy's primary challenge remains how to accommodate China's economic aspirations
- Unusual market dynamics in 2024 include simultaneous strong performance of gold bullion and S&P500 (both near 25% gains)
- The Japanese Yen has continued to weaken, contrary to previous analyst predictions
